channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: US defense bill may be problematic for USDC and stablecoins: Analysts
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: A proposed U.S. national defense bill could subject stablecoins issuers to KYC and AML requirements they would be unable to comply with, said Berenberg analyst Mark Palmer.

item.title: Is SBF secretly behind BALD? Crypto Twitter debates latest conspiracy
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: Crypto Twitter has been set ablaze with a new conspiracy that Sam Bankman-Fried is secretly pulling the strings of a new memecoin on Base called BALD.

item.title: Crypto staking rewards are taxable once received: IRS
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: The United States tax collector will require taxpayers to count staking rewards as gross income at the time they gain “dominion" over the tokens.

item.title: Base’s largest DEX, LeetSwap, halts trading amid exploit concerns
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Some analysts have provided possible ways the exchange was exploited and pinned potential initial losses at over $600,000.

item.title: Nifty News: Yuga Labs to buy metaverse studio, Etihad NFT staking to take off and more
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Roar Studios will be acquired by Yuga Labs as the latter looks to onboard talent for its still-in-development Otherside metaverse.

item.title: ‘Let’s just diversify and see’ — Binance CEO on its stablecoin strategy
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: Due to regulatory and transparency risks, CZ says that spreading risk across different stablecoins is key.

item.title: Judge rejects motion to dismiss Terraform case, disagrees with Ripple decision
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: Judge Jed Rakoff gave a detailed interpretation of the Howey test that was at odds with the decision in the Securities and Exchange’s case against Ripple.

item.title: We need to fundamentally change how smart contracts operate
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Eitan Katz
item.description: Smart contracts should be viewed as “proof-of-concept” rather than as critical for universal adoption. That may mean exploring alternatives.

item.title: Crypto market loses $486M in July, most since 2022: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: According to the report, nearly half of the month’s losses were caused by the Multichain exploit, which resulted in $231 million in losses alone.

item.title: Republican candidate wants to end President Biden’s supposed ‘war on Bitcoin’ if elected
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: “As president, on day one, CBDC goes into the trash can — we’re not going to allow it," said Ron DeSantis at a New Hampshire campaign event.

item.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Serge Egon Ostman
item.category: why did the Fed pause rates
item.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting the Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

item.title: Where’s the recession? These 3 economic indicators can alert investors to a market downturn
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Analysts have called for a U.S. recession all year, but stocks continue to creep higher. Here are three metrics investors can watch to know if an economic downturn is coming.

item.title: Researchers develop blockchain verification service for cultural artifacts
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: A combination of human expertise, NFTs and blockchain technology could help humanity protect its priceless artifacts from theft and looting.

item.title: First major success in US Congress for two crypto bills: Law Decoded
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: In a 35–15 vote, the House Financial Services Committee approved the Financial Innovation and Technology for the 21st Century Act.

item.title: Bitcoin mining update: Stocks cool off, miners send BTC to exchanges to prep for halving
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Nivesh Rustgi
item.description: Bitcoin miners make moves in preparation for the BTC block reward halving, which is scheduled for April 2024.

item.title: German government watchdog launched Worldcoin probe in November 2022: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Authorities in the United Kingdom and France have also reportedly cited concerns over Worldcoin’s data collection methods, which involve collecting iris scans from users.

item.title: Price analysis 7/31: SPX, DXY, BTC, ETH, XRP, BNB, ADA, DOGE, SOL, LTC
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: Bitcoin’s record low volatility is also a sign that the next price breakout will be volatile, but everyone is guessing which direction the price will go and how it will impact altcoins.

item.title: What is Worldcoin, and how does it help preserve World ID?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Shailey Singh
item.description: Human or an AI bot? Get your eyeballs scanned by OpenAI CEO Sam Altman’s Worldcoin Orbs to prove digital identity and earn cryptocurrency.

item.title: BALD token developer denies rug pull as price falls 85% post-launch
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The BALD memecoin collapsed in price as collectors alleged an exit scam, but the developer claims not to have sold any coins.

item.title: Bitcoin volume hits lowest since early 2021 amid fear $25K may return
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: BTC price retracing deeper than $25,000 is “possible,” analyst warns, with $28,300 the line in the sand for Bitcoin bulls.

item.title: Japan Blockchain Association demands tax cuts for crypto
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: Advocates of the crypto industry in Japan demand the revision of the national tax regime for digital assets.

item.title: SEC files complaint against Hex founder for allegedly offering unregistered securities
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: According to the SEC, Richard Heart allegedly used more than $12 million of investor funds to buy “a 555-carat diamond, expensive watches, and high-end automobiles.”

item.title: Tether’s excess reserves up to $3.3B, holds $72.5B worth of US Treasury bills
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: Tether has released its latest reserves attestation for USDT, with its excess reserves increasing to $3.3 billion.

item.title: Chinese city implements plan for blockchain digital infrastructure system by 2025
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The government of Shanghai has implemented a strategic plan to develop its urban blockchain digital infrastructure system between 2023 and 2025.

item.title: How blockchain is transforming fundraising for startups and entrepreneurs
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Anthony Clarke
item.description: Investors and entrepreneurs can create and execute investment agreements directly on the blockchain.

item.title: Whale reclaims $74M in ETH locked in ENS auction
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: ENS founder Nick Johnson urged users to check their addresses and reclaim their deposited funds.

item.title: CEX price feed prevents Curve price from collapsing amid $100M vulnerability
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: A vulnerability in the Vyper programming language widely used by DeFi protocols like Curve Finance led to the exploit of multiple Curve liquidity pools on Sunday, July 30.

item.title: 7 YouTube channels to learn machine learning
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Alice Ivey
item.description: YouTube channels, including Sentdex and Data School, offer in-depth data science and machine learning explorations to enhance data-driven decision-making.

item.title: Ethical hacker retrieves $5.4M for Curve Finance amid exploit
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: Twitter accounts impersonating Curve Finance have also started to promote a fake refund scheme, further targeting victims of the hack.

item.title: South Korea to pilot CBDC in one of these three cities, not Seoul
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: South Korea pushes forward with its CBDC pilot and targets three potential test regions for issuing and distributing the digital currency.
